intro: Ledebouria viridis, commonly known as the green bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, bulbous form and produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions. Ledebouria viridis is also valued for its resilience and low maintenance requirements in gardens.
